frameDefinitions: Generally without overall (translational) motion,  an Agent places a Theme at a location, the Goal, which is profiled.
An Evaluator participates in an Experience (or metonymically, a salient Entity of the Experience), often for the first time, in order to form an opinion about its quality.
An Agent sets down in permanent form information about the occurrence of a Phenomenon.
An Author creates a Text, either written, such as a letter, or spoken, such as a speech,  that contains meaningful linguistic tokens, and may have a particular Addressee in mind.

This frame involves a static (primarily spatial) relationship between a Location and a Theme, in which the Theme is located in many or all subregions of the Location, and is thus construable as covering it.
A Record that contains a permanent account of Data.
frameExamples: David <t>placed</t> his briefcase on the floor.
Have you <t>tried</t> my latest get-rich-quick scheme? INI
While visiting in Port Alberni, the day before he was diagnosed, we <t>recorded</t> him to have 14 drinks and go to the bathroom 10 times.
I <t>penned</t> a letter concerning racism to Congress.
The bank's <t><fex name='Record'>books</fex></t> were not accurate.
listRoleDefinitions: The <fen>Agent</fen> is the person (or other force) that causes the <fen>Theme</fen> to move.
The <fen>Theme</fen> is the object that changes location during the Placing.
The role <fen>Goal</fen> is the location where the <fen>Theme</fen> ends up. This role is profiled by words in this frame.
<fen>Time</fen> is when the Placing occurs
The <fen>Place</fen> indicates where the Placing occurs.
The person (or metonymic manifestation thereof) that participates in the <fen>Experience</fen>.
The activity or event that the <fen>Evaluator</fen> participates in.
<fen>Entity</fen> is something that the <fen>Evaluator</fen> uses to try an <fen>Experience</fen>, and metonymically stands in for the <fen>Experience</fen>.
A more explicit description of what the <fen>Evaluator</fen> seeks to learn by having the <fen>Experience</fen>.
The temporal location during which the <fen>Experience</fen> occurs.
The physical location in which the <fen>Experience</fen> occurs.
The <fen>Agent</fen> is the sentient entity that creates a permanent record of the <fen>Phenomenon</fen>.
The <fen>Phenomenon</fen> is the entity or situation in the world of which a <fen>Agent</fen> becomes aware.
That feature of the <fen>Entity</fen> which is under discussion.
The <fen>Value</fen> of the <fen>Entity</fen> that is recorded for the specified <fen>Attribute</fen>.
An <fen>Entity</fen> for which the <fen>Agent</fen> records the <fen>Value</fen> of an <fen>Attribute</fen>.
This role identifies the <fen>Time</fen> when the <fen>Agent</fen> creates the record of the <fen>Phenomenon</fen>.
The location where the <fen>Agent</fen> sets down the facts.
The <fen>Author</fen> produces a particular <fen>Text</fen>.
The entity which results from the act of writing or speaking.
This role identifies the <fen>Time</fen> at which the text is created.
Where the event takes place.

The <fen>Theme</fen> in this frame is the object which is described as standing in some spatial relation to a particular <fen>Location</fen>.  <fen>Theme</fen> typically occurs as the External Argument or, with passives, as a PP Complement headed by 'with' or 'by'.
<fen>Location</fen> is the entity or area with respect to which the <fen>Theme</fen>'s spatial arrangement is described.  This frame element generally occurs as an NP Object.
The time at which the <fen>Theme</fen> occupies the <fen>Location</fen>.
The <fex name='Record'>Record</fex> is the entity in which events or accounts are permanently recorded.
The region where the <fen>Record</fen> is sold, circulated, or otherwise popular
listRoleExamples: <fex>The waiter</fex> placed the food on the table.
The waiter placed <fex>the food</fex> on the table.
The waiter placed the food <fex>on the table</fex>.
Grass , which is sown with clover , provides rich pasture for cattle in summer and the clover is <fex>another plant which</fex> puts nitrogen into the soil .
Smithers had placed the table there <fex>the night before</fex>.
<fex>She</fex> tested out six cars before finding the one she liked.
Have you ever tried <fex>working out with kettlebells?</fex>
We tried out <fex>the games</fex>, and they're fun.
I tried out my neighbors vacuums <fex>to see if they met my needs</fex>
Try it out <fex>at midnight</fex>.
I tried it for the first time <fex>at home</fex>.
Police informed Mr Wong that <fex>they</fex> recorded the attack as a racial incident.
Adams took some very good advice and meticulously recorded <fex>the events that ensued</fex>.

When Mohammed was sentenced to death in the Anti-Terrorism Court in Rawalpindi
the court recorded <fex>his age</fex> as  17 or 18.

In the fiscal year 2000, Nepal's imports from China and Tibet were recorded <fex>at
166.6 million dollars</fex>.
At the time the Army recorded <fex>him</fex> as a married resident of the Town of Two Creeks.
From what the book says, these events were recorded <fex>in the Chamber of Mazarbul</fex> .
Michael wrote <fex>a frame description</fex>.
<fex>Ribbons</fex> festooned the car.
Thick varnish coated <fex>the beautiful wood</fex>.
<fex>By 1950</fex>, factories dotted the adjacent countryside.
She kept a <fex>record</fex> of how many times he asked to borrow money.
